section.name: Introduction
section.p: Onyx is the application that manages participant interviews at the assessment centers. This application is currently under development by a team of 8 people. The timelines are short.. Very little documentation is available for now and this web site is far from complete due to lack of time. If you are interested in knowing more about the project or wish to collaborate, please contact directly info@obiba.org. Only a very general overview of the system is provided here.

section.name: Overview
section.p: In Onyx, an interview is represented formally as a sequence of stages that participants have to pass through in order to complete their visit at the assessment center. For example, the informed consent signature is usually the first required stage of any interview. The main responsibility of Onyx is to provide the applicative backbone into which independent data collection software used by stages (e.g. a CAPI software for questionnaire administration) can be easily plugged (Figure 1). This modular and generic architecture allows a very customizable system. Biobanks can configure Onyx for their own specific stages and software.

Once configured, Onyx controls both the order and availability of the stages (e.g. no stages are available prior to informed consent signature) and captures many administrative parameters such as starting and ending times of each stage. Onyx also manages participant appointment and reception as well as data exportation to the study central database. See some screenshots.
